definitions.title: n. f.
definitions.body: :Le 2:5 (cf. on gender Albrecht:ZAW xvi (1896), 106) fine flour (LXX semi/daliv, Vulgate simila) (NH id.; Aram. [[סוּלְתָּא]]; Ar. sultun a kind of barley without husks Lane:1401; As. sillatu, or šillatu, a kind of grain (?) Meissner-Rost:BAS iii, 361; also ṯulṯȧ, ṯuruti, flour, as loan-word in Egypt., Bondi:84 WMM:As. u. Eur. 101);—abs. ´[[ס]] Ge 18:6 +, cstr. ´[[ס]] Ex 29:9 +; sf. [[סָלְתָּהּ]] Le 2:2; —fine flour, used in king's household 1Ki 5:2 (‖[[קֵמַח]]), for honoured guests ´[[קֶמַח ס]] Ge 18:6 (J), a sₑ’āh of it sold for a shekel in time of scarcity 2Ki 7:1, 2Ki 7:16, 2Ki 7:18 (v. Benz); luxurious food Ez Eze 16:13, Eze 16:19 (of Jerus. under fig. of woman); elsewh. only in offerings Ez Eze 46:14, 1Ch 9:29, 1Ch 23:29, and P; [[חִטִּים]] ´[[ס]] Ex 29:2, ´[[ס]] v:Ex 29:40, Le 2:1 + 13 t. Lv., Nu 6:15 + 26 t. Nu.
